hero.content:
Has the Philippines Moved On From Marcos Sr.’s Dictatorship?

“This is what happens when you bring despots and their scions back to power,” says a Filipino political science professor

time.com

primary.title: Rescuers in high-risk volcano search for crashed Philippine plane
primary.description: Four people, including two Australians, were on board the Cessna 340 aircraft that crashed on Mount Mayon volcano.

secondary.title: "Very risky" search planned as plane wreckage spotted near active Philippine volcano's crater
secondary.description: An aerial search team spotted suspected wreckage of the small plane about 1,150 feet from the crater of Mayon Volcano.

secondary.title: Search on Philippine volcano confirms 4 died in plane crash
secondary.description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Searchers who hiked the slopes of a restive Philippine volcano to find the wreckage of a plane that crashed over the weekend confirmed the two Australian energy consultants and two Filipino crew members on board didn't survive, the local mayor said.

secondary.title: Bodies of 4 passengers of crashed Cessna plane in Albay retrieved
secondary.description: Authorities have retrieved the bodies of the four passengers of the Cessna plane that crashed near Mayon Volcano's crater in Albay a week ago, Camalig Mayor Carlos Baldo confirmed.

carousel.title: People Power Anniversary: Should we care? - Manila Standard
carousel.description: The country celebrates the 37th anniversary of the People Power Revolution on Feb. 25 this year, and the event still remains an important and significant milestone for Philippine society.

carousel.title: The Philippines’ Basic Education Crisis
carousel.description: Out of the country’s 327,000-odd school buildings, less than a third are in good condition, according to government figures.

carousel.title: See Photos of the Site in Masungi the BuCor Wants to Build On
carousel.description: Lot 10 of Masungi hosts fragile limestones, endangered species, and plants found nowhere else in the world.

carousel.title: Philippines: Six years on, arbitrary detention of former Senator Leila de Lima continues
carousel.description: As witness after witness withdraws testimony, the Marcos administration must put an end to her ongoing persecution.
